He added that they are now out of the 'woods' and are proudly part of Indian cinema. "Each and every film will now be from Indian cinema," Johar further stated.

176.title: India only play in Dubai, are they afraid of Sharjah?: Ex-Pak bowler Bakht
176.article_body: Ex-Pakistan bowler Sikander Bakht said India "only play" in Dubai, going on to question if they're "afraid" of playing in Sharjah. "India were scheduled to play against Pakistan in Sharjah. You guys changed it to Dubai," added Bakht. "That ground's been pretty bad for us...We're in strong favours with...ICC, so we're not playing there," jokingly reacted ex-India cricketer Atul Wassan.

177.title: Alleged Al-Qaeda member arrested in Mumbai's Bandra
177.article_body: The Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad and the West Bengal Special Task Force (STF) arrested a person from Bandra East for suspected terror links. The accused has been identified as Saddam Hussain Khan and is suspected to be a member of Al-Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent (AQIS). He is accused of radicalising young men and recruiting for the terror outfit.

178.title: Delhi Police share traffic advisory in view of Congress' 'Mehangai par halla bol' rally
178.article_body: Delhi Traffic Police have shared advisory for commuters in view of Congress' 'Mehangai par halla bol' rally that will be held in the national capital today. Ranjit Singh Flyover from Barakhamba Road to Guru Nanak Chowk, Vivekanand Marg, JLN Marg (Delhi Gate to Guru Nanak Chowk), roundabout Kamla Market to Guru Nanak Chowk and Chaman Lal Marg will remain closed.

179.title: Hyderabad's Cyberabad sub-inspector jailed for 2 yrs for taking bribe
179.article_body: The First Additional Special Judge for SPE & ACB cases convicted a sub-inspector posted in Hyderabad's Cyberabad Police Station to two years of imprisonment and imposed a fine of ₹5,000 for accepting bribe. The accused K Rajendra was trapped by Anti Corruption Bureau while demanding and accepting a bribe of ₹10,000 from complainant for releasing motor vehicle detained by him.

180.title: One of the world's oldest zoos in Bristol shuts down after 186 years
180.article_body: Bristol Zoo Gardens, one of the world's oldest zoos, welcomed visitors for the last time on Saturday as it shut down after 186 years. The zoo claims to have welcomed 9 crore visitors since it opened in 1836 and helped save 175 species from extinction. Notably, the zoo was home to the first-ever rare black rhino born in the UK.

181.title: Javed Akhtar may be communist but wrote bhajans in Lagaan in pure Hindi: Vivek
181.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri, speaking about lyricist Javed Akhtar, has said, "Even a man like Javed, the bhajans he wrote for 'Lagaan' were pure Hindi." He further called Javed "well-read, intelligent" and a person who is tied to Indian roots. "He may be a communist, he may fight against the right-wing, it doesn't matter," Vivek concluded.

182.title: Man out on bail throws acid on woman in UP; woman escapes unhurt
182.article_body: A female 'lekhpal', a revenue official, escaped unhurt after a 30-year-old man threw acid on her in Uttar Pradesh's Agra, police said on Friday. The accused, who's on the run, had previously assaulted the official a year ago and was out on bail in the case, police added. The official was on her way to work when the incident occurred.

183.title: 2 arrested for 'hookah, non-veg boat party' on river Ganga in Uttar Pradesh
183.article_body: Two of eight youths who were seen smoking hookah and roasting meat on boats over Ganga river in Daraganj area of Uttar Pradesh were arrested on Saturday. The youths have been identified as 25-year-old Mohd Asif and 30-year-old Hassan Ahmad. "They are...being questioned so as to identify other six youths who were with them during the boat ride," police said.

184.title: UP preferred destination for investors due to improved law & order: CM Yogi
184.article_body: CM Yogi Adityanath on Saturday said that Uttar Pradesh has become the preferred destination for investors because of improved law and order which has changed UP’s earlier image. "No riots took place in the last five-and-a-half years. The state is receiving huge investments and employment opportunities are being generated," CM Yogi added.

185.title: Barack Obama wins Emmy for narration in 'Our Great National Parks' documentary
185.article_body: Former US President Barack Obama was awarded an Emmy for narrating in Netflix documentary series 'Our Great National Parks', the Television Academy announced. "The 44th US President is now an Emmy winner for Outstanding Narrator," the Television Academy tweeted. Obama had already won Grammy Awards for audio versions of his memoirs 'The Audacity of Hope' and 'Dreams from My Father'.

186.title: Pakistani terrorist captured days ago dies of cardiac arrest in J&K
186.article_body: A Pakistani terrorist who was captured during an infiltration attempt about a fortnight ago died of cardiac arrest in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district on Saturday, said officials. A trained Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terrorist, 32-year-old Tabarak Hussain underwent surgery at a military hospital after he was critically injured by the Indian Army, according to officials.

187.title: Mumbai witnesses heavy rainfall and thunderstorms; people share pics, videos
187.article_body: Mumbai, on Sunday, witnessed heavy rainfall and thunderstorms. Several residents of the city took to Twitter to share pictures and videos of the weather. "Another round of crazy thunderstorms going on...since 7:30 am," one user wrote. Meanwhile, another wrote, "Sounds like thor is coming [to] Mumbai." "Can't get lovelier than this," a twitter user wrote while sharing a video.

188.title: 20-yr-old Rahmanullah smashes highest score in T20 Asia Cup history, breaks Rohit's record
188.article_body: Afghanistan's 20-year-old opener Rahmanullah Gurbaz on Saturday night recorded the highest score in men's T20 Asia Cup history. Rahmanullah scored 84(45), including four fours and six sixes, against Sri Lanka in the first Super 4 stage match of Asia Cup 2022. The previous record was held by Rohit Sharma, who slammed 83 runs off 55 deliveries against Bangladesh in 2016.

189.title: Insurance agents in Mumbai booked for cheating 1,129 policyholders
189.article_body: Tata AIG General Insurance company filed a police complaint in Mumbai against a group of more than 10 insurance agents for cheating 1,129 policyholders of the company and causing a loss of ₹1.53 crore to the company. The accused would collect the four-wheelers' insurance premium from policy buyers and deposit the two-wheelers' premium with the insurance company, the police said.

190.title: US' Death Valley breaks record for hottest September day anywhere on planet, hits 53°C
190.article_body: US' Death Valley National Park broke the record for the hottest September day anywhere on planet after its Furnace Creek thermometer hit nearly 53°C (127°F) on Thursday. This comes less than a month after monsoon rain caused flash flooding in Death Valley, damaging several roads. Death Valley holds the world record for hottest temperature at 56.7°C, measured in July 1913.

191.title: India reports 6,809 new COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, positivity rate at 2.12%
191.article_body: India has reported 6,809 new COVID-19 cases and 21 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Health Ministry. Additionally, five reconciled deaths from earlier period were added in Kerala. This comes a day after the country recorded 7,219 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in the country dropped to 55,114, while the daily positivity rate stood at 2.12%.

192.title: Don't use unacceptable language against Mamata: TMC MP to Opposition
192.article_body: TMC MP Saugata Roy has warned Opposition leaders against using "unacceptable language" against West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. "If you (Opposition) call Mamata Banerjee the queen of thieves, be ready for a hard blow on your back," said Roy. "If you call her the queen of corruption, you never know how our party workers will react in anger," he added.

193.title: 1 dead on Kinnaur-Chitkul trek, search ops ordered for 5 missing people
193.article_body: One person died while five others went missing while they were on the Kinnaur-Chitkul trek. The five missing people include two trekkers and three porters. They were reportedly trekking from Khimloga Pass in Uttarakhand towards Himachal. The Disaster Management Authority of Himachal Pradesh has ordered a search and rescue operation for the missing trekkers and porters.

194.title: India set to become the 3rd largest economy in world by 2029: SBI report
194.article_body: The Indian economy is set to become the third largest economy in the world by 2029, an SBI research report has found. India is currently the world's fifth largest economy after overtaking the UK. According to the SBI report, India is on pace to pip Germany in 2027 and Japan by 2029, at its current rate of growth.

195.title: Tommy Hilfiger, Calvin Klein owner announces plan to fire 10% staff globally
195.article_body: PVH Corp, the owner of brands like Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger, has announced job cuts. The company said it planned "to reduce people costs in its global offices by approximately 10%" by the end of the next year to streamline the organisation and improve efficiency. It also said that it expected a revenue decline this year.

196.title: BJP won’t be able to stop JD(U) from becoming national party: Lalan Singh
196.article_body: JD(U) chief Lalan Singh said whatever "tricks" the BJP may play, it won’t be able to stop JD(U) from becoming a national party by 2023. "The BJP should worry about itself...They should think of their fate in 2024 when the entire Opposition will stand united against them," Singh added. His statement came after five JD(U) MLAs joined BJP in Manipur.

197.title: ₹2.3-crore Bentley car stolen from London found during raid in Pakistan; pic viral
197.article_body: Bentley Mulsanne, which was allegedly stolen from the UK's London, was recovered during a raid conducted by the customs department in Pakistan's Karachi. People involved in the whole racket managed to import the car to Pakistan using documents of a top diplomat of an east European country, according to reports. The vehicle costs more than $300,000 (around ₹2.3 crore).

198.title: Layoffs a chance to prove haters wrong, says Snap CEO amid 20% job cuts: Report
198.article_body: In a meeting held with employees after he confirmed 20% job cuts, Snap CEO Evan Spiegel reportedly said that while this was a setback, it was a chance to "prove the haters wrong". Some employees said that the alleged statement didn't help the meeting's tone and mood. Snap is laying off around 1,200 employees to reduce costs amid weak revenue.

199.title: 'Brahmāstra' sells over 27,000 tickets via advance booking: Report
199.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva' has sold over 27,000 tickets at three national chains through advance booking within 24 hours, reported Pinkvilla. The film has sold more tickets through advance booking than the Hindi version of SS Rajamouli's 'RRR', the report added. 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva' will mark Ranbir and Alia's first film together.

200.title: Japan 'declares war' on floppy discs, plans to phase out retro tech
200.article_body: Japan's Digital Minister Taro Kono has "declared a war" on floppy discs and other retro technology used in the country and is looking to phase them out. Around 1,900 government procedures still require businesses to use floppy discs, CDs and mini-discs, the Minister noted. At a recent conference, he asked, "Where does one even buy a floppy disc these days?"

201.title: Excited to be working with Kartik Aaryan again: Kiara on 'SatyaPrem...'
201.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani opened up about working with actor Kartik Aaryan in the film 'SatyaPrem Ki Katha' after the success of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. "I'm excited to be working with him once again! It's a love story, my favourite genre, where I play Katha, and he plays Satya," she stated. "Fortunately, our pairing...worked well in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'," she added.

202.title: US' Death Valley breaks record for hottest September day anywhere on planet, hits 53°C
202.article_body: US' Death Valley National Park broke the record for the hottest September day anywhere on planet after its Furnace Creek thermometer hit nearly 53°C (127°F) on Thursday. This comes less than a month after monsoon rain caused flash flooding in Death Valley, damaging several roads. Death Valley holds the world record for hottest temperature at 56.7°C, measured in July 1913.

203.title: My films aren't working as Kapil Sharma jinxes it, jokes Akshay Kumar
203.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar appeared in 'The Kapil Sharma Show' to promote his film 'Cuttputlli' along with Rakul Preet Singh. In the promo of the episode, Kapil asked him, "Brother, how do you turn a year younger on every birthday?" To this, Akshay jokingly replied, "Kapil jinxes everything I do, my films, my money...now none of my films are working."

204.title: Congress vanishing from country, world getting rid of communist parties: Shah
204.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah said the Congress is vanishing from the country and the world is getting rid of communist parties. "If Kerala has a future, it's BJP. The [PM] Modi regime can bring much-needed change in the state," Shah added. "The Congress party and Communists never worked for the welfare of the Scheduled Tribes and the poor," Shah stated.

205.title: Man who cheated woman on promise of marriage held: Rachakonda Police
205.article_body: Cybercrime police have arrested a 31-year-old man who allegedly cheated a woman of about ₹7.13 lakh after offering to marry her, Rachakonda Police tweeted on Sunday. In 2021, the accused asked for money by claiming various issues and later when the woman asked about marriage, he stopped responding to her calls. The accused and the woman had met in 2016.

206.title: Ex-SC judge says 'If I say I don’t like PM's face, somebody might arrest me'; Rijiju replies
206.article_body: A former Supreme Court judge, Justice B N Srikrishna, has said that if he were to say publicly that he doesn't like the PM's face, somebody might raid him or arrest him. Union Minister Kiren Rijiju responded, "Those people who speak all the time without any restrictions to abuse the popularly elected Prime Minister are crying about freedom of expression!"

207.title: Bhartaul becomes 1st village in UP to have RO water in every home
207.article_body: As part of the Adarsh Gram Panchayat initiative, Bhartaul in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly district reportedly became the first village in the state to have RO water in every household. Four RO plants have been set up in the village to make clean water accessible to everyone. "It will save people from water-borne diseases," said Jag Pravesh, Chief Development Officer, Bareilly.

208.title: Rahmanullah Gurbaz smashes highest score in T20 Asia Cup history, breaks Rohit's record
208.article_body: Afghanistan's 20-year-old opener Rahmanullah Gurbaz on Saturday night recorded the highest score in men's T20 Asia Cup history. Rahmanullah scored 84(45), including four fours and six sixes, against Sri Lanka in the first Super 4 stage match of Asia Cup 2022. The previous record was held by Rohit Sharma, who slammed 83 runs off 55 deliveries against Bangladesh in 2016.

209.title: BJP can be reduced to 50 seats in 2024 if Opposition unites: Nitish
209.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Saturday said that the BJP could be confined to less than 50 seats in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections if the Opposition parties set aside their differences and unite. He said he would visit Delhi to work for a larger Opposition alliance. This comes after five JD(U) MLAs in Manipur joined BJP.

210.title: Pune woman gets nose surgery as husband beats her for not decorating Ganpati
210.article_body: A 31-year-old woman in Pune had to undergo plastic surgery for her nose after her husband allegedly threatened her and beat her up with an iron rod for not decorating lord Ganesha idol amid the ongoing Ganesh Chaturthi festival. The woman's mother-in-law was also involved in the incident. "We have registered...FIR against the man and his mother," police said.

211.title: Pune records 2nd hottest September day since 1996 with 34.4°C temperature
211.article_body: Pune, on Saturday, recorded its second hottest day in September since 1996. Reports said that 34.4 degrees Celsius day temperature was recorded in Pune on Saturday. “The temperature rise is due to sunlight at forenoon...day temperature over 33 degrees Celsius along with high moisture have resulted in general cloudy conditions during the afternoon and evening time,” an official said.

212.title: Railways to undertake 5-hr jumbo block between 2 Mumbai stations today
212.article_body: The Western Railway has announced that it will be holding a jumbo block of five hours on up and down slow lines between Santacruz and Goregaon stations today (September 4). The jumbo block will be in place from 10 am to 3 pm. The block is announced to carry out maintenance work of tracks, signalling and overhead equipment.

213.title: Fire breaks out in Delhi's Rajouri Garden, 25 fire tenders bring it under control
213.article_body: A fire broke out in a tent godown located near Vishal Enclave of Rajouri Garden in Delhi. Fire Department officials said that the fire brigade was called at 1 am, following which, 25 fire tenders were rushed to the site. News agency ANI reported that it took one and a half hours for the fire to be brought under control.

214.title: Qatar to allow beer sales at FIFA World Cup matches 3 hours before kickoff: Report
214.article_body: Qatar will allow ticketed fans to buy alcoholic beer at FIFA World Cup matches starting three hours before kickoff and for one hour after the final whistle, Reuters reported. However, beer sales won't be allowed during matches, report added. Beer would be available for sale within ticketed perimeter surrounding each stadium, but not in stadium stands or concourse, report stated.

215.title: Telangana CM, TRS taking instructions from AIMIM: State BJP chief
215.article_body: Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar on Saturday accused the ruling TRS of taking instructions from AIMIM over the celebration of Hyderabad Liberation Day. "After BJP decided to celebrate September 17 as 'Hyderabad Liberation Day', all parties responded," he said. "But when AIMIM demanded to celebrate 'National Integration Day'...the state government came forward to celebrate it," he added.

216.title: Karnataka logs 941 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death
216.article_body: Karnataka on Saturday reported 941 new cases of COVID-19 and one death due to the infection, as per the state health department. The active caseload in the state stood at 5,203, the daily COVID-19 bulletin said. Bengaluru Urban district recorded 526 cases, the maximum among districts. Bidar, Gadag and Yadgir districts did not report any fresh COVID-19 cases or deaths.

217.title: 4 people shot at on Rohtak university campus over ₹6 lakh debt
217.article_body: Four people, including two students, were shot at by three men over a monetary dispute in Rohtak's Maharshi Dayanand University on Saturday, police said. The incident took place shortly after Haryana Governor Bandaru Dattatreya left the campus following an inaugural event. A complainant said that a man, who owed him ₹6.40 lakh, and his aides opened fire on the campus.

218.title: Michael Schumacher in the best of hands: Former Ferrari F1 boss
218.article_body: Former Ferrari F1 boss Jean Todt said seven-time World Champion Michael Schumacher "is in the best of hands" as he recovers from severe brain injuries due to a 2013 skiing accident. "People ask so much about Michael...(he is) surrounded by people who love him...we are in constant contact," said Todt. The F1 legend is recuperating at his home in Switzerland.

219.title: Few athletes have inspired more people: Barack Obama on Serena Williams
219.article_body: Former US President Barack Obama congratulated tennis player Serena Williams on her career after the 40-year-old athlete retired from the sport on Friday. "Congratulations, Serena, for your heart, skill, intelligence, dedication, and grace," Obama tweeted. He added, "Few athletes have inspired more people both in and beyond their sport!" Williams has won 23 Grand Slam singles titles in her career.

220.title: Labourer killed in wall collapse in Delhi's Mustafabad, 2 injured
220.article_body: A labourer was killed after a wall collapsed at a construction site in northeast Delhi's Mustafabad area on Saturday, police said. The deceased was identified as 25-year-old Manoj Kumar. Two others were injured in the incident. The injured have been admitted to the Jag Pravesh Chandra Hospital, the police informed.

221.title: 25 lakh households received zero electricity bills: Punjab Minister
221.article_body: Punjab Power Minister Harbhajan Singh on Saturday said the AAP government in Punjab has fulfilled its promise of providing 300 units of free electricity per month. He added that 25 lakh households have received zero electricity bills. This was the first time a government is fulfilling its election promises in the initial year itself, Singh claimed in a statement.

222.title: Bail application of seer Shivamurthy Murugha postponed to Monday
222.article_body: The application seeking anticipatory bail for Murugha Mutt seer Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru has been postponed to Monday by a district court in Karnataka. He had reportedly applied for bail on medical grounds. Earlier, he had been taken to hospital after complaining of chest pain. He has been accused of sexually assaulting two girls in a hostel run by the mutt.

223.title: Too early to rule Ravindra Jadeja out of T20 World Cup 2022: Dravid
223.article_body: Team India head coach Rahul Dravid said it is too early to rule Ravindra Jadeja out of T20 World Cup 2022 after the all-rounder suffered a knee injury. "The World Cup is a fair way away, so we don't want to jump to any conclusions," said Dravid. Earlier, PTI had reported that Jadeja would need a "major knee surgery".

224.title: That was insane: Red Bull F1's Verstappen on taking pole in Dutch GP
224.article_body: F1 world champion Max Verstappen took pole position at the 2022 F1 Dutch GP, beating Ferrari's Charles Leclerc by less than a tenth of a second. "Unbelievable...We had a difficult day...it was very close...that was insane," said Verstappen. Ferrari's Carlos Sainz came third, with Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton in fourth after Red Bull's Sergio Perez spun out in the final corner.

225.title: No bowler in current Pakistan line-up can replace Shaheen Afridi: Rizwan
225.article_body: Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan said no bowler in the current line-up could replace injured Shaheen Afridi. "The way he [Shaheen] has performed in the last 1-2 years, no bowler can...fill his shoes," said Rizwan, adding that this was the opportunity to find the next Shaheen. Pakistan qualified for the Asia Cup Super Four after beating Hong Kong on Friday.

226.title: ONGC is being deliberately destroyed by PM Modi: Jairam Ramesh
226.article_body: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh criticised PM Narendra Modi for running ONGC without a regular CMD (Chairman and Managing Director) since April 2021. "ONGC was a crown jewel. Then...[PM Modi] forced ONGC to absorb GSPC (Gujarat State Petroleum Corporation), a scam-ridden company," Ramesh tweeted. He added, "[ONGC is] being deliberately destroyed so that one of the 'Humare Do' takes it over."

227.title: Explore joint solutions to water disputes: Amit Shah to south states
227.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has urged southern states to look for joint solutions to address water-sharing disputes. Shah was addressing the 30th southern Zonal Council Meet in Thiruvananthapuram on Saturday. Inter-state water disputes in the south include the Krishna river water sharing dispute between Telangana and Andhra Pradesh and the Cauvery dispute between Tamil Nadu and Karnataka.

228.title: Vijay Deverakonda to return ₹6 crore to 'Liger' producers after film flops: Reports
228.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda has planned to give back a large portion of his remuneration for 'Liger' to the producers to compensate for the film's box-office performance, as per reports. He will reportedly return more than ₹6 crore to the producers to reduce the burden of losses. 'Liger' was reportedly made on a budget of ₹100 crore.

229.title: There is an 'undeclared emergency' in the country: JD(U)
229.article_body: The Janata Dal (United) on Saturday passed a resolution alleging that there is an "undeclared emergency" in the country. It also alleged that the BJP government is trying to silence the Opposition voices by misusing probe agencies. The party also claimed that minorities are being targeted in the country. The national executive meeting of JD(U) was held on Saturday.

230.title: 32-year-old man gets 20 years in prison for minor's rape in Odisha
230.article_body: A court in Odisha's Ganjam district on Saturday handed a 20-year prison sentence to a 32-year-old man for abducting and raping a 14-year-old girl in 2018. The court also imposed a fine of ₹55,000 on the convict. The rape survivor was awarded a compensation of ₹6 lakh. The convict had sexually assaulted the teenager after kidnapping her from her home.

231.title: Karan Johar and Rajamouli have united the Indian film industry: Jr NTR
231.article_body: Actor Jr NTR, during the promotional event for 'Brahmastra' in Hyderabad, said that Karan Johar and SS Rajamouli have united the Indian film industry. "Let us hope...Karan sir achieves yet another milestone with this movie," he added. Karan Johar is producing the upcoming film. Jr NTR further said he hopes "Brahmastra emerges as the Brahmastra of our Indian film industry".

232.title: World noted India's independent stance on Ukraine war: EAM Jaishankar
232.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Saturday said India's stand on the Russia-Ukraine war was "noted" by the world. Speaking at the Indian Institute of Management, Ahmedabad, Jaishankar said when two countries are at war there is pressure on third parties to carefully choose sides. "The fact that we have taken an independent stance...that the world has noted," he said.

233.title: India's first female racing champion Alisha Abdullah joins BJP
233.article_body: Indian bike and car racing champion Alisha Abdullah joined the BJP in Chennai on Saturday. BJP's Tamil Nadu President K Annamalai was present in the event. "I am very happy to welcome a true sporting icon and fabulous competitive racer today," Annamalai said. Alisha is the country's first female national racing champion.

234.title: Tribal girl found hanging from tree in J'khand, mother alleges rape
234.article_body: A 14-year-old girl belonging to the tribal community was found hanging from a tree in Jharkhand's Dumka district, police said on Saturday. The victim's mother has alleged that she was raped, killed and hanged from the tree on Friday. The minor was allegedly sexually exploited by a man on the pretext of marriage.

235.title: Armed groups clash in Libyan capital
235.article_body: Armed factions in Libya fought on the outskirts of Tripoli on early Saturday as groups close to Abdulhamid al-Dbeibah's government consolidated their position. The violence took place in Warshafala which has seen regular clashes in the last 11 years since a NATO-supported movement ousted veteran leader Muammar Gaddafi. Presently, Dbeibah's rival Fathi Bashagha has support in the country's east.

236.title: What is non-Hodgkin's lymphoma that has affected actress Jane Fonda?
236.article_body: Actress Jane Fonda has shared that she has been diagnosed with non-Hodgkin lymphoma. Non-Hodgkin lymphoma is a type of cancer that forms in the lymph system. It begins when a type of white blood cell, called a T cell or B cell, becomes abnormal. The signs and symptoms include swollen lymph nodes, fever, drenching night sweats, weight loss and fatigue.

237.title: I almost died in that event: Serena on French Open 2015 win being her proudest achievement
237.article_body: On being asked about the proudest achievement of her career, Serena Williams said, "[Winning] French Open 2015." She added, "That's definitely the one that I'm taking with me because I almost died in that event. Somehow I won. So that was pretty awesome." Serena was suffering from flu during the tournament and played with a 101-degree fever in the semi-final.

238.title: Zimbabwe's Sikandar Raza criticises commentators for calling Maxwell's dismissal 'lucky'
238.article_body: After Zimbabwe defeated Australia by three wickets on Saturday to record their first-ever ODI victory against Australia in Australia, Zimbabwe batter Sikandar Raza criticised commentators for calling Glenn Maxwell's dismissal "lucky". "It was a lucky one, he knows how lucky it was," a commentator said. Sharing the video, Sikandar wrote, "How's this a lucky one...Please someone help me out here."

239.title: Thousands attend Gorbachev's farewell in Moscow; Putin absent
239.article_body: Thousands of mourners attended late former Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev's farewell ceremony in Moscow on Saturday. Later, Gorbachev, who died at the age of 91 earlier in the week, was buried next to his wife Raisa at Novodevichy Cemetery. Putin was absent from the farewell and was said to be travelling to Russia's westernmost exclave, Kaliningrad on the day.

240.title: Sharmila never received criticism for Mansoor's underperformance: Mumtaz
240.article_body: Veteran actress Mumtaz reacted to the hatred that the wives and girlfriends of cricketers receive when they fail to perform on the field. She said her contemporaries Sharmila Tagore and Reena Roy never received criticism if Mansoor Ali Khan Pataudi and Mohsin Khan underperformed. "Why are Bollywood actresses never praised when their cricketer-husband or boyfriends do well on...field?" said Mumtaz.

241.title: Deoghar DC charged with sedition on MP's complaint over airport row
241.article_body: A Zero FIR has been registered by Delhi Police against Deoghar Deputy Commissioner (DC) Manjunath Bhajantri on various charges including sedition on a complaint by BJP MP Nishikant Dubey. This comes after Dubey and nine others, including BJP MP Manoj Tiwari, were booked by Jharkhand Police for allegedly barging into Deoghar airport's air traffic control (ATC) room earlier this week.

242.title: Mahesh Babu's daughter makes 1st television appearance, actor pens note
242.article_body: Mahesh Babu on Saturday penned a note for his daughter Sitara on Instagram as she made her first television appearance. Mahesh and Sitara appeared together on 'Dance India Dance Telugu'. He wrote, "Sitara's first time on television...and our first appearance together...couldn't be more special! Watching her interact with everyone and dance...with such confidence...was a moment of pride for me!"

243.title: Obesity, psychological problems linked to excessive screen time: Study
243.article_body: Excessive screen time can cause obesity and psychological problems in people, a study stated. "Excessive exposure to blue light from...TVs, laptops and phones may have detrimental effects on a wide range of cells in our body, from skin and fat cells to sensory neurons," a researcher said. "[Avoiding]...excessive blue light exposure may be a good anti-ageing strategy," he added.

244.title: Rizwan going back not out was big no; what's the point of it in T20: Wasim
244.article_body: After Pakistani opener Muhammad Rizwan scored 78*(57) against Hong Kong, former pacer Wasim Akram said that Rizwan "going back not out" to him "was a big no". "If you are tired, try to hit boundaries and maybe get out and try and get fresh legs in the middle...What is the point in this format (T20) going not out," Akram asked.

245.title: EU well-prepared in case Russia ceases gas supply: EU official
245.article_body: The European Union is "well-prepared" to face the eventuality of a total halt in gas supply by Russia, thanks to storage capacity and energy-saving measures, EU's Economic Commissioner said on Saturday. Notably, Russian state-run gas company Gazprom on Friday announced that gas supply via the Nord Stream 1 pipeline to Germany would remain suspended indefinitely due to technical reasons.

246.title: Appalled by unruly conduct of FM Sitharaman with Collector: KTR
246.article_body: After Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman questioned Kamareddy District Collector Jitesh Patil over the absence of PM Narendra Modi's pictures at fair price shops, Telangana minister KT Rama Rao said, "I am appalled by [Sitharaman's] unruly conduct." He also complimented Patil on his "dignified conduct", adding, "These political histrionics...will only demoralise hardworking AIS officers."

247.title: Govt school PTI booked for sexually harassing girl students in Rajasthan
247.article_body: A Physical Training Instructor (PTI) of Kendriya Vidyalaya school in Rajasthan's Jodhpur has been booked for sexual harassment and indecent behaviour with girl students. At least 12 girls aged between 15-17 years have alleged that the accused used to call them on phone and force them to have obscene talks with him. The girls had complained to the school management.

248.title: Iran says it has equipped 51 cities with civil defence systems
248.article_body: Iran's Defence Ministry on Saturday said that 51 cities in the country have been equipped with civil defence systems to prevent any possible foreign attacks. The systems enable authorities to "identify and monitor threats by using round-the-clock software, according to the type of the threat and risk", Deputy Defence Minister General Mahdi Farahi said, as per the local media.

249.title: Shah directs Ahmedabad civic body to solve garbage disposal issues in 3 days
249.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has directed the Amdavad Municipal Corporation (AMC) to resolve the issue of garbage disposal in the localities of Bopal, Ghuma and Ambli within three days. Shah has asked Municipal Commissioner Lochan Sehra to resolve the issue, which has emerged due to a strike by sanitation workers, BJP's Gujarat unit said.

250.title: 3 killed, 5 injured in lightning strike in MP's Singrauli
250.article_body: Three persons were killed and five others were injured due to a lightning strike on Saturday in Madhya Pradesh's Singrauli, police said. Out of the five injured persons, the condition of two women was critical, an official said. The deceased were identified as 55-year-old Shyam Lal Kol, 52-year-old Meru Prasad Saket and 40-year-old Laxman Prasad Kol, Inspector Anil Upadhyay said.

251.title: Dynasty politics by Cong caused great loss to country: BJP leader
251.article_body: BJP leader Prakash Javadekar on Saturday criticised Congress and said the dynasty politics by the party has caused great loss to the country. "Look at our party, be it PM Modi and other leaders...from where did they come," Javadekar said at a programme in Jaipur. "They came from ordinary families with no political background, muscle or money power," he added.

252.title: Dravid avoids saying 'sexy' while answering during press conference, video goes viral
252.article_body: A video went viral showing India head coach Rahul Dravid avoiding saying the word 'sexy' during press conference. "I'm very confident that we've a very good bowling attack that produces results, might not be as, umm, I wanted to use a word but can't." After a journalist said if it is "exuberant", Dravid said, "No...It's four-letter word, starts with S."

253.title: NIA searches 16 locations in Assam in ULFA recruitment case
253.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Friday conducted searches at 16 locations in Assam in connection with the United Liberation Front of Asom (ULFA) recruitment case and militant training in Myanmar. "Digital devices, live ammunition...incriminating documents and literature related to ULFA have been seized," the NIA stated. The investigations in the case are still in progress, NIA added.

254.title: Man hangs himself in Maha, mother jumps into well on seeing his body
254.article_body: A 26-year-old man named Shailesh Patil allegedly hanged himself from a tree near his house in Maharashtra's Palghar on Thursday. On seeing the son's dead body, his 40-year-old mother jumped into a well and ended her life, a police official said. The family conducted their last rites without informing police, the official said, adding that police are investigating the matter.

255.title: UK approves 2nd bivalent COVID-19 vaccine
255.article_body: Health authorities in the UK on Saturday approved the second "bivalent" vaccine which will be used as a booster dose to gain protection against the original strain of coronavirus and its Omicron variant. The jab can be given to individuals above 12 years of age. "Clinical trial...showed a strong immune response," said the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency.

256.title: 'Modi-Modi' chanted as Gehlot visits temple in Raj; BJP shares video
256.article_body: A group of devotees chanted "Modi-Modi" as Rajasthan CM and Congress leader Ashok Gehlot visited a temple in Jaisalmer on Friday. Sharing a video of the incident, BJP state President Satish Poonia called it "trends for 2023 and 2024 elections". "Devotees were expressing their choice by raising slogans…Gehlot…was accepting the greetings by shaking hands," minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat tweeted.

257.title: Rolls of Congress' internal elections not to be made public
257.article_body: Congress' Central Election Authority Chairman Madhusudan Mistry on Saturday said electoral rolls to elect the party's next president would not be made public. "No question of making it public," Mistry said. Earlier in the week, senior Congress leaders Shashi Tharoor, Anand Sharma, Manish Tewari, Pradyut Bordoloi and Karti Chidambaram said making the rolls public would ensure transparency.

258.title: 25-yr-old transgender man dies after attack in German pride parade
258.article_body: A 25-year-old transgender man has died after he was attacked at an LGBT+ Pride event in the west German city of Münster last week, police said. The news of Malte C's death triggered outrage with politicians and LGBT+ rights advocates demanding action. Reportedly, Malte was protecting a group of women from an attacker at the parade when he sustained injuries.

259.title: Teesta Setalvad walks out of prison a day after SC grants her bail
259.article_body: Activist Teesta Setalvad walked out of Sabarmati Central Jail in Ahmedabad a day after the Supreme Court granted her interim bail in a case related to the 2002 Gujarat riots. Setalvad has been in jail since June 26 for allegedly fabricating evidence related to the riots. She has been let out on bail after furnishing a personal bond of ₹25,000.

260.title: NASA's Artemis 1 Moon rocket launch postponed again due to fuel leak
260.article_body: NASA's Artemis 1 Moon mission has been postponed again ahead of the rescheduled launch today. "Teams attempted to fix an issue related to a leak in the hardware transferring fuel into the rocket, but were unsuccessful," NASA stated. Earlier, its first launch attempt was called off on August 29 due to an issue with an engine bleed.

261.title: Detergent allegedly used to cook mid-day meal in WB's Dinajpur
261.article_body: Several students of a school in West Bengal's Uttar Dinajpur reportedly fell ill and started vomiting after eating the mid-day meal on Friday. Local authorities said their investigation found that detergent or powdered soap was mixed with the meal instead of salt, leading to the incident. Protesting parents reportedly locked the headmaster and teachers inside an office.

262.title: School principal kidnapped in Maharashtra; ₹30 lakh ransom sought
262.article_body: A 50-year-old school principal was allegedly kidnapped by unidentified persons in Maharashtra's Nagpur, who have demanded ₹30 lakh ransom for his release, police said on Saturday. His two-wheeler vehicle was found parked in front of a hospital, an officer said. Police have registered a case in this connection and have formed several teams to trace the victim.

263.title: Pak are laying a foundation too deep; unnecessary in T20s: Sanjay
263.article_body: Former India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar commented on the middle order of the Pakistan T20 side in the ongoing Asia Cup. "They (Pakistan) are laying too deep a foundation. For a 20-over innings, it's unnecessary," Manjrekar said. He added, "What's more it...[needs to] give more opportunity to number four, five [and] six, thereby making Pakistan a more wholesome batting unit."

264.title: 48-year-old IVRI employee dies while dancing at birthday party in UP, video surfaces
264.article_body: Prabhat Kumar, a 48-year-old man working at Indian Veterinary Research Institute (IVRI) in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly, died while dancing at a birthday party. A video has surfaced on social media showing Prabhat performing a solo dance and suddenly collapsing mid-way. He was then rushed to a hospital, where the doctors declared him dead. He reportedly suffered a severe heart attack.

265.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
265.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, has issued very heavy rainfall warning for several states. Very heavy rainfall is likely over some parts of Karnataka and Kerala on September 6 and 7. It is likely over Tamil Nadu and Puducherry on September 6. Parts of Arunachal Pradesh, West Bengal, Sikkim and Uttarakhand may witness very heavy rainfall tomorrow.

266.title: 'RRR' actress Ahmareen Anjum ties the knot with actor Danny Sura, shares pics
266.article_body: Actress Ahmareen Anjum, who played a character named Loki in Rajamouli's 'RRR', tied the knot with actor Danny Sura in Kolkata on August 20. Taking to Instagram on Saturday, Ahmareen shared a series of pictures from her wedding ceremony and wrote, "Fortunate to have found my soulmate...We seek your love [and] blessings as we embark on this new journey together!"

267.title: Opposition will unify for 2024 elections: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
267.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar called for Opposition's unity in 2024 elections and said there is a need to think about how BJP is allegedly poaching MLAs from other parties. "When we parted ways from the NDA, all our six Manipur MLAs came...and assured us they were with JDU," said Kumar. He further questioned the constitutionality of the alleged poaching.

268.title: Six debt-ridden farmers die by suicide within 24 hours in Vidarbha
268.article_body: Six debt-ridden farmers died by suicide in Maharashtra's Vidarbha region within a 24-hour period on Friday and Saturday. A state government body said the farmers' crops were ruined due to the unprecedented rains and they failed to get fresh loans to sow their fields. Vidarbha has seen the most farmer deaths by suicide in Maharashtra in the past two years.

269.title: Sitharaman scolds Collector over no pic of PM at ration shop in T'gana, video surfaces
269.article_body: A video shows Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman scolding Kamareddy District Collector Jitesh Patil when he couldn't provide an answer to what the Centre and state's share was in the rice supplied through fair price shops. She also asked why PM Modi's picture was missing at a shop. "Our people will come and put up...PM's banner here," she told him.

270.title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar can never become PM in his life: BJP MP Sushil Modi
270.article_body: BJP Rajya Sabha MP Sushil Kumar Modi on Saturday said Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar can never become Prime Minister in his life. "Posters and hoardings don't make anyone the Prime Minister. If a leader only has 5-10 MPs from his party, how can he become...PM?" he said, adding Nitish broke alliance with NDA just to remain in news.

271.title: Johar touches Nagarjuna's feet at event, says 'Dad was a friend of Nag sir'
271.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, during a promotional event for 'Brahmastra' in Hyderabad, touched the feet of Nagarjuna who also marked his presence along with Jr NTR and SS Rajamouli. "My father was a dear friend of Nag sir, and I feel that legacy of love continues," Johar said. He added that Nagarjuna was the "favourite person" on the sets of 'Brahmastra'.

272.title: We all knew you were the greatest: LeBron James on Serena Williams
272.article_body: Los Angeles Lakers forward LeBron James termed 23-time Grand Slam Champion Serena Williams as "unbelievable", adding he can speak about her journey for "an hour". "We all knew you were the greatest...It's been an honour to watch...you conquer all the goals...you ever set out, to see you break records," stated James. "What...you have done for women...is unprecedented," he said.

273.title: 150-foot-wide asteroid to pass past the Earth today: NASA
273.article_body: A gigantic killer asteroid named 2022 QO31 is going to pass past the Earth on September 3, NASA said. The asteroid will pass from 5.3 million kilometres away from the Earth. However, if any last-minute deviation takes place, the 150-foot-wide asteroid can reach the Earth in two days. It is travelling at a speed of 30,420 kmph.

274.title: Ukraine's attempt to seize nuclear plant thwarted, claims Russia
274.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry on Saturday claimed that its forces on Friday night thwarted the Ukrainian military's attempt to capture the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant. Over 250 troops of Ukraine's Navy attempted a landing on the coast of a lake near the plant, the ministry said. Russian forces foiled the attack with strikes from military helicopters and fighter jets, it added.

275.title: 6, including lady gang leader, charged under Gangster Act in UP
275.article_body: Six people, including a lady gang leader along with her husband, have been booked under the Gangster Act in Mainpuri, UP. The police had recently arrested members of a robbery gang, which was headed by the female accused, identified as Vineeta, police said. Vineeta used to travel on e-rickshaws and intoxicate fellow travellers before stealing their belongings, police added.

276.title: 11-yr-old boy killed as wall collapses in UP's Bareilly
276.article_body: An 11-year-old boy, identified as Gaurav Kumar, was killed in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly on Saturday after a wall of his neighbour's house collapsed on him while he was playing, police said. Another boy was injured in the incident. Neighbours pulled the boys out of the debris and took them to a hospital where Gaurav was declared dead, the SP said.

277.title: Teacher, headmaster arrested for assaulting student in Rajasthan
277.article_body: A teacher and a headmaster of a private school in Rajasthan's Sikar have been arrested for allegedly assaulting a student. Police said the Class 12 student was allegedly slapped by his teacher for not following instructions to stand in line properly during a prayer meeting. Later, he was allegedly thrashed by both the accused, the victim's family claims.

278.title: If Kerala has a future, it's BJP: Amit Shah in Thiruvananthapuram
278.article_body: Addressing the southern zonal council meeting in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram, Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said if the state has a future, it's the BJP. "Congress is vanishing from the country, the world is getting rid of communist parties," Shah said. "Congress...and the Communists never worked for the welfare of the Scheduled Tribes and the poor," Shah added.

279.title: Need to make educational institutions future ready: President Murmu
279.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu on Saturday said there is a need to make educational institutions future ready with new teaching and learning metrics, pedagogy and content. Addressing the closing ceremony of Diamond Jubilee celebrations of Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi, President Murmu called IITs the country's pride and said, "Their story is the story of independent India."

280.title: Afghanistan have all their bases covered, confidence is high: Jaffer
280.article_body: Former India batter Wasim Jaffer said that the Afghanistan team have "covered all their bases". "The [Afghanistan] batters are playing well, they have world-class spinners and the pacers have done well too," Jaffer said. He added, "So,...the confidence is high considering they defeated both their opponents [in the group stage]...Afghanistan is definitely the favourites to win [against Sri Lanka]."

281.title: British tourists charged ₹112 for using toilet at Agra railway station
281.article_body: Two British tourists were reportedly charged ₹112 each for using washroom in the executive lounge of the Agra Cantt railway station. The amount included 12% GST as well. As per reports, IRCTC clarified it's a mandatory fee charged by the executive lounge, after which a passenger can stay inside for two hours, use free wifi and also avail free coffee.

282.title: Minister came to hotel & stayed till 2 am, took voters to 1 floor: Bhutia on AIFF elections
282.article_body: After losing the AIFF elections to Kalyan Chaubey, ex-captain Bhaichung Bhutia said he was shocked as he didn't expect political interference of "high level". "If they (his opponents) were...confident...why a powerful Union Minister had to come at...hotel (where voters were staying)...and stay there till 2 am in...morning of election day...and take all of them to particular floor," Bhutia stated.

283.title: Dalit student hit with metal rod, broom for touching UP teacher's bike
283.article_body: A Class 6 Dalit student in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia was allegedly locked up in a classroom and beaten with a metal rod and a broom by his teacher for touching the latter's motorcycle, police said on Saturday. The other staff of the school rescued the boy, police added. According to a Basic Shiksha Adhikari, the accused teacher has been suspended.

284.title: Ravindra Jadeja's knee injury serious, set to miss T20 World Cup 2022: Reports
284.article_body: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja is set to miss T20 World Cup 2022 as he'll undergo a knee surgery, reports said. "Jadeja's right knee injury is pretty serious. He's supposed to undergo a major knee surgery and will be out of action for indefinite period of time," a senior BCCI official told PTI. The T20 WC 2022 will begin next month.

285.title: Lakhs of people to attend rally against price rise: Cong leader Venugopal
285.article_body: Talking about 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Congress MP KC Venugopal said they're (Congress) set for a massive rally against price rise which will be attended by lakhs of people. "This agitation started 2021 onwards, we can proudly say we are the party that's fighting against price rise in the country," he said. The Yatra will take place from Kanyakumari to Srinagar.

286.title: Take steps to galvanise economy: Kerala CM to Centre
286.article_body: Speaking at the 30th southern zonal council meeting, chaired by Union Minister Amit Shah, Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan urged the Centre to enable the states to "undertake productive spending to galvanise the national economy". "The fiscal empowerment of the Union and the states are of equal importance to meet the long impact of the pandemic on the economy," he said.

287.title: 18 killed in al-Shabaab attack in Somalia, food aid trucks burnt
287.article_body: At least 18 civilians were killed in an overnight attack by al-Shabaab militants in Somalia's central region, the country's state news agency reported on Saturday. The al-Shabaab fighters also burnt several trucks carrying food aid, the report added. According to media reports, "most of the people on board the vehicles (relief food trucks)" were killed in the attack.

288.title: 7 torch vehicles over complaint against Bengal headmaster; arrested
288.article_body: The West Bengal Police on Saturday arrested seven persons for torching vehicles and creating unrest in Purba Medinipur over a corruption complaint against a school headmaster, Nandakumar SHO Manoj Kumar Jhano said. Police personnel, who were attacked by students and locals when they tried to control the situation, had to resort to lathicharge to disperse the mob, the SHO added.

289.title: They see beauty in everything: Nawazuddin on female directors
289.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui, while sharing his experience of working with female directors, said that women look at the world differently. He added that they are far more compassionate and see beauty in everything. Nawazuddin has worked with several female directors, including Nandita Das, Anusha Rizvi, Zoya Akhtar, Reema Kagti and Debamitra Biswal.

290.title: NGT orders Bengal to pay ₹3,500 crore for gap in waste management
290.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has imposed a penalty of ₹3,500 crore on the West Bengal government for allegedly not managing solid and liquid waste, causing harm to the environment. Continuing damage is required to be prevented in the future and past damage is to be restored, the bench said. The penalty is to be paid within two months.

291.title: Thank you for inspiring all of us to pursue our dreams: Woods on Serena
291.article_body: Talking about Serena Williams whose defeat against Ajla Tomljanovic in the US Open marked the last match of her career, golfer Tiger Woods tweeted, "Thank you for inspiring all of us to pursue our dreams." "How lucky were we to...watch a young girl from Compton...become one of the greatest athletes of all time," tweeted former US First Lady Michelle Obama.

292.title: Cleric passing info on military to Pakistan arrested by J&K Police
292.article_body: J&K Police have, with inputs from Military Intelligence, arrested a local cleric from a mosque in Kishtwar for allegedly running a terror-cum-espionage module. Abdul Wahid was reportedly working for terror group Kashmir Janbaaz Force, which is being controlled by Pakistan. The 22-year-old cleric was allegedly passing information on military deployment and movement to his contact across the border.

293.title: Liquor sale banned in certain areas of Bengaluru during this weekend
293.article_body: In view of the Ganesh Chaturthi's idol immersion processions over this weekend, the Bengaluru Police have prohibited the sale of liquor in certain areas of the city. The areas are located across three police divisions namely the eastern, north-eastern and northern divisions of Bengaluru. However, the dates of the prohibition order's implementation vary across areas.

294.title: Govt shares pics of 'future look' of New Delhi Railway Station, Twitter users react
294.article_body: Ministry of Railways shared photos of the proposed design of the to-be redeveloped New Delhi Railway Station. While some Twitter users appreciated the modern architecture, one comment read, "This looks great but seems like 2050 plan looking at the amount of land acquisition/development this requires." "Glass building in heat of...Delhi...Just wasting money," another comment read.

295.title: Kartik Aaryan, Kiara Advani begin shooting for 'SatyaPrem Ki Katha'
295.article_body: Director Sameer Vidwans' 'SatyaPrem Ki Katha', starring Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani, went on floors on Saturday. The actors took to their respective Instagram handles to share the news, writing, "Sattu Aur Katha. Love Story Begins Today." The film is a musical love story that brings Kartik and Kiara together for the second time after 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'.

296.title: Hyd BJP Corporator arrested for allegedly kidnapping 22-yr-old man
296.article_body: Baddam Prem Maheshwar Reddy, BJP Corporator from Hyderabad's Gaddiannaram, was arrested on Saturday in connection with the alleged kidnapping of a 22-year-old man from PNT Colony. Earlier, police traced the man to Nalgonda and made three arrests. While interrogating the arrested men, police learnt that Reddy had pre-planned the kidnap and made arrangements for a car to abduct the man.

297.title: Tenure extension of St Stephen's principal illegal: DU
297.article_body: Delhi University (DU) has told St Stephen's College's Chairman, its Supreme Council and Governing Body that its Principal John Varghese is continuing illegally in the post since March 2021. DU said the college did not follow University Grants Commission regulations when extending his term. DU said it found the college's Supreme Council violating due processes and procedures.

298.title: 18-yr-old Gauff, 28-yr-old Garcia reach their maiden 4th round at US Open
298.article_body: US' Coco Gauff and France's Caroline Garcia entered the fourth round at the US Open for the first time in their career on Friday. The 18-year-old American, who is playing in her third US Open, beat compatriot Madison Keys 6-2, 6-3 in the third round, while the 28-year-old Frenchwoman defeated former champion Bianca Andreescu 6-3, 6-2.

299.title: Court issues contempt notice to Delhi Police Commissioner in rape case
299.article_body: A Delhi court has issued a contempt notice to Police Commissioner, Delhi, in an alleged gangrape case. The bench noted Sangam Vihar Police Station registered the FIR in the case after 36 days of the victim filing a complaint before the Station House Officer. The court said this "depicted a sordid and pathetic state of affairs" in Delhi Police's administration.

300.title: Pilot allegedly steals plane, threatens to crash it into US Walmart store; video surfaces
300.article_body: A pilot allegedly stole an aircraft and threatened to crash it into a Walmart store in US' Tupelo. The police evacuated the buildings and asked citizens to avoid the area. Several users on Twitter shared videos showing the plane flying in circles over homes and businesses. All emergency services in the area are on alert.

301.title: Class 2 boy mauled by 2 pitbulls in Bengaluru, his face disfigured
301.article_body: Two pitbulls reportedly attacked a Class 2 student for the second time in around seven months in Bengaluru. His father claimed that the dogs' owner, who lives in the same building as the seven-year-old boy, had provoked the dogs to attack the child during an argument. "My son's face has been disfigured...He needed 58 stitches...His condition is critical," he added.

302.title: Pune leading shift to alternative transport fuel: Fadnavis
302.article_body: The Maharashtra government is shifting public transport to alternate fuel and Pune is leading the change, Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis said. "The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) is leading the change with 650...electric buses, which implies that 30% of PMPML transportation is using alternative fuel," he said. Fadnavis spoke at an electric bus depot launch in Pune.

303.title: Delhi Police personnel assaulted in road rage incident
303.article_body: A Delhi Police head constable was allegedly assaulted by two motorcycle-borne men in Delhi's Vikaspuri area in a road rage incident on Thursday. According to police, the victim was travelling in his car when he was signalled to stop by a motorcycle rider. The biker and his pillion rider assaulted the victim after complaining about his driving, police said.

304.title: Bengaluru Police bust car stealing racket; 2 arrested
304.article_body: The Bengaluru Police have arrested two people for running a car stealing racket across Delhi and Bengaluru. The accused used to steal cars and then change their number plates and chassis numbers, police said. Nine cars worth around ₹1.2 crore have been recovered by the police. The DCP (Bengaluru Central Division) RS Gowda congratulated the team on their success.

305.title: Almost 100% Indians breathing polluted air: Report
305.article_body: Over 99% of India's population is breathing polluted air, a report by Greenpeace India stated on Friday. Most people living in India are exposed to PM2.5 concentrations, which is five times more than the annual average guideline prescribed by WHO. As per the report, most polluted region in India is Delhi-NCR, followed by Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Haryana and West Bengal.

306.title: Mumbai's Lokmanya Tilak Terminus to get pod hotel
306.article_body: After Mumbai Central and Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT), the railways is planning to bring a large-sized pod hotel at Kurla's Lokmanya Tilak Terminus (LTT). "Pod hotels offer a comfortable and affordable overnight staying option to passengers at stations. At the Kurla LTT...it will be opened near the Passenger Reservation System (PRS) ticket counter," a railway official said.

307.title: Everyone in industry is saying 'bhakton ne barbad kar di': Vivek on 'Laal...'
307.article_body: Vivek Agnihotri, speaking about failure of 'Laal Singh Chaddha', said, "Everyone in...industry is saying 'bhakton ne film ko barbad kar diya (bhakts ruined the film)'." "But...how many votes PM Narendra Modi gets? 40% okay? So let's take this 40-50% away...Where are...rest of...people?" he said, adding people didn't watch the film because they didn't know what it was all about.

308.title: Indian men's hockey team is now focussing on 2022-23 FIH Pro League: Surender
308.article_body: Indian men's hockey team defender Surender Kumar said his side is now focussing on 2022-23 FIH Hockey Pro League matches against New Zealand and Spain, beginning October 28. "We've to work hard and correct our mistakes in the camp now so that the mistakes don't happen again," he added. India won a silver medal at CWG 2022 last month.

309.title: Want to develop Rajasthan as centre of religious tourism: CM Gehlot
309.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Saturday said his government wants to develop the state as a centre of religious tourism. "The state government is committed to providing the devotees all kinds of facilities and security," he said. "All religious places in the state should be beautiful and equipped with all facilities," CM Gehlot added.

310.title: 2 cab drivers abduct, rape 25-yr-old woman in Bengaluru; arrested
310.article_body: Two cab drivers were arrested in Bengaluru for allegedly abducting and raping a 25-year-old woman on the pretext of dropping her to her destination, police said. The woman was reportedly walking on a road on Wednesday when she was approached by two bike-borne men, who took her to an isolated place and raped her. They also kept her in captivity.

311.title: Can't be a sentence less than life imprisonment for murder convict: SC
311.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday said that there cannot be any sentence/punishment less than life imprisonment, if an accused is convicted of murder. Justices MR Shah and Krishna Murari made the statement while quashing the judgement of Madhya Pradesh High Court, which had reduced the sentence of a murder convict from life imprisonment to the sentence already undergone by him.

312.title: Axar is correct like-to-like replacement for Jadeja at Asia Cup: Irfan
312.article_body: Commenting on Ravindra Jadeja being replaced by Axar Patel in India's squad for remainder of Asia Cup 2022, Irfan Pathan said the all-rounder is the "absolutely correct like-to-like replacement". He added, "Only problem is that Jadeja had become such a fantastic batter that you could've batted him up the order, you might not be able to do that with Axar."

313.title: 3, including a woman, killed as bike collides with truck in UP
313.article_body: Three people, including a woman, were killed in Uttar Pradesh's Sonbhadra on Saturday after the motorcycle they were travelling on collided head-on with a truck, police said. The deceased were identified as 25-year-old Majmuddin Ansari, 27-year-old Ishtiyak Ansari and 30-year-old Gulabi. The trio died on the spot, while the truck driver escaped after the accident, SHO Lakshman Parvat said.

314.title: Efforts being made to defame Rajasthan: Gehlot on NCRB report
314.article_body: After the report of National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) was released, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said efforts are being made to defame the state. It would be appropriate to compare the figures of 2019 and 2021 as there was a lockdown in 2020, Gehlot said. "Uttar Pradesh is ahead in...murder cases, crime against women and kidnapping," he added.

315.title: 20-yr-old man dies after speeding BMW sports car falls off Yamuna Expressway in Noida
315.article_body: A 20-year-old man was killed while another was injured after a speeding BMW sports car spun out of control and fell off the Greater Noida Yamuna Expressway on Saturday morning. The incident happened near Galgotias University in Dankaur area. The accident took place at around 8.30 am when the two men, who hail from Haryana, were going towards Agra.

316.title: SC to hear plea on violence against doctors on Monday
316.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday will hear a plea seeking directions to ensure adequate security at hospitals and medical centres to deter attacks on doctors and healthcare workers, primarily by relatives of patients. The petition also seeks directions to Centre and states for the formation of a distress fund to grant compensation to victims of such violence or their families.

317.title: There's so much to learn from them: Mouni on co-stars Ranbir, Alia
317.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy in an interview said her 'Brahmastra' co-stars Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt are very disciplined and amazing human beings. "There's so much to learn from the two of them," Mouni said, adding, "One thing I tell everybody, whenever I get asked about Ranbir-Alia, is that they are fire. They light up on screen."

318.title: Drug smuggling accused arrested by Odisha Police from Ghaziabad
318.article_body: The main accused in a drug smuggling case was arrested by a Special Task Force (STF) team of Odisha Police from Ghaziabad on Thursday. The arrest was in connection with the seizure of 202 grams of cocaine worth around ₹50 lakh from Bhubaneswar in April this year. The Odisha Police team was assisted by UP Police in making the arrest.

319.title: Ousted SL Prez gets official residence, security on return: Officials
319.article_body: Sri Lanka's ousted President Gotabaya Rajapaksa was provided with an official residence and security by the government after he returned home on Saturday after fleeing the country in July, officials said. Rajapaksa fled Sri Lanka on July 13 following mass protests amid the economic crisis. He had resigned after arriving in Singapore on July 14 and later travelled to Thailand.

320.title: Ayan has put a lot of energy into creating Astraverse: Rajamouli on Brahmastra
320.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli, who was roped in to present Ayan Mukerji's directorial 'Brahmastra' in South, has said this kind of film needs to be supported. "When Ayan started narrating about these Astras to me, all my childhood fantasies came to life," he added. Rajamouli further said Ayan has put a lot of energy into creating 'Astraverse'.

321.title: Scindia urges states to lower VAT on aviation turbine fuel
321.article_body: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia urged states to reduce value-added tax (VAT) on aviation turbine fuel (ATF). He said only 16 of the 24 states had responded positively to this proposal, adding that ATF accounted for 40% of the airlines' cost structure. Scindia said currently only eight states are charging VAT at 20-30%, while 16 states charge 1-4% VAT rates.

322.title: He was always keen to take the ball: Rajkumar on Kohli's bowling
322.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli's bowling, his childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said the India batter was always confident as a bowler. "Morne Morkel did dent his confidence a bit in...past (laughs) but he was always keen to take the ball...used to say- 'give me the ball, I will pick wickets'," he added. Kohli posted 1-0-6-0 against Hong Kong at Asia Cup.

323.title: Ghana man swallows 87 cocaine capsules worth ₹13 cr, held in Mumbai
323.article_body: The Customs department arrested a passenger from Ghana at the Mumbai airport for trying to smuggle cocaine into India by hiding it in 87 capsules that he had swallowed. The Customs said 1,300 grams of cocaine valued at ₹13 crore was recovered. The accused was reportedly admitted to a state-run hospital, where he ejected those capsules over three days.

324.title: PM Modi writes letter to UAE President to strengthen strategic ties
324.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has written a letter to UAE President Sheikh Mohamed Bin Zayed Al Nahyan to talk about further strengthening strategic relations between the countries. PM Modi's letter was delivered by EAM S Jaishankar when he met the UAE President in Dubai. According to UAE's news agency, the letter also talks of developing strategic relations to serve common interests.

325.title: Pune's Corbevax vaccine wastage rate higher than state average
325.article_body: Pune district's Corbevax vaccine wastage rate is higher than the state average as fresh COVID-19 cases continue to fall. While the vaccine wastage rate in Maharashtra is 13.31%, the wastage rate in Pune district is 13.86%. In Pune district, only 1,054 Corbevax doses have been used as precaution, said State Immunisation Officer Dr Sachin Desai.

326.title: T'gana BJP leader criticises Owaisi over 'China occupying 10 villages' remark
326.article_body: Telangana BJP leader NV Subhash criticised AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi over his comments attacking the Centre. Subhash said Owaisi is spreading negativity, adding, "He is giving provocative and false statements." "I also hope INS Vikrant will give PM Narendra Modi the courage to speak up about China which has occupied 10 villages of our territory," Owaisi had said.

327.title: No rules violated: BJP's Nishikant Dubey on Deoghar airport incident
327.article_body: After being booked for forcing flight take-off at the Deoghar airport, BJP MP Nishikant Dubey rejected all the claims and said that there was no violation of rules. "File as many cases you want to file. A total of 37 cases have been filed against me and my family...This fight will continue for justice," said Dubey.

328.title: US customer data compromised in July cybersecurity breach: Samsung
328.article_body: Samsung Electronics said on Friday that the personal information of some customers in the US was compromised as it suffered a cybersecurity breach in late July. The company said that customers' social security numbers and credit card numbers were not affected, however, information including name, contact and demographic details, date of birth and product registration data had been compromised.

329.title: Cong to hold protest in Delhi on Sunday against price rise, GST
329.article_body: The Congress is set to hold a protest at Delhi's Ramlila Maidan on Sunday against price rise, unemployment and the GST hike on essential items. Rahul Gandhi and other party leaders would address the rally in which workers from Delhi, Haryana, UP and other parts of the country would participate. Sonia and Priyanka Gandhi would not be attending the event.

330.title: Couple's bodies recovered from rail tracks in UP, suicide suspected
330.article_body: The bodies of a 22-year-old man and a 19-year-old woman were recovered from railway tracks in Uttar Pradesh's Banda district. According to police, the two were in a relationship, however, their family members were against it as they belonged to different castes. They allegedly died by suicide by jumping in front of a moving train on Saturday, police added.

331.title: Russia sees over 50,000 new COVID-19 cases for 2nd straight day
331.article_body: For the second consecutive day on Saturday, Russia reported more than 50,000 new COVID-19 cases, with 51,699 testing positive. The country also recorded 92 coronavirus-related deaths over the last 24 hours, the government's coronavirus task force said. Russia reported 50,952 new COVID-19 cases on Friday, breaching the 50,000 mark for the first time in almost six months.

332.title: Very soon we will break JD(U)-RJD alliance in Bihar: BJP's Sushil Modi
332.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Kumar Modi has said, "Very soon, we will break the JD(U)-RJD alliance in Bihar and make the state JD(U) free." Commenting on five JD(U) MLAs joining BJP in Manipur, he said, "The state has become JD(U)-free. Those MLAs wanted to remain in NDA." He further said that nobody can become the PM by installing hoardings and posters.

333.title: We are determined to implement price cap on Russian oil: US
333.article_body: The US has said it is "determined" to enforce a price cap on Russian oil announced by G7 countries, even as Moscow said that it would stop selling oil to nations that impose price caps. "A price cap on Russian oil is a powerful tool...in our agenda to put downward pressure on global energy prices," White House Press Secretary said.

334.title: I'm ready to be a mom, explore a different version of myself: Serena
334.article_body: Following her loss in the last match of her career in US Open 2022 third round, 40-year-old Serena Williams said, "I'm ready to...be a mom, explore a different version of Serena." She added, "Technically in the world I'm still super young, so I want to have a little bit of a life while I'm still walking."

335.title: Hyd company to recycle Noida twin towers' waste into green building material
335.article_body: The 30,000 tonnes of debris left after the demolition of Noida's twin towers will be recycled into green building material by Hyderabad-based company Re Sustainability Ltd. It'll process 300 tonnes of waste, including concrete, steel and iron per day at its Noida plant. "We're looking forward to witnessing magnificent infrastructure developed using...recycled material," the company CEO said.

336.title: 7-yr-old Thane boy drowns in lake meant for Ganesh idol immersions
336.article_body: A seven-year-old boy, Jaihad Azhar Shaikh, from Rabodi in Thane drowned in a lake meant for Ganesh idol immersions on Friday night, an official said. The incident took place at Ambe-Ghosale Lake when the deceased went for a swim at 8 pm, chief of Thane civic body's Regional Disaster Management Cell said. He added that the body was recovered.

337.title: Mysterious explosion in Hyd leaves house with no walls, couple injured
337.article_body: A mysterious explosion in a house on the first floor of a building in Ramgopalpet in Secunderabad left the house with no walls. Other parts of the building were also damaged in the incident. A couple living in the house was seriously injured and was shifted to a local hospital. CCTV visuals reportedly showed the moment of the blast.

338.title: Nora Fatehi might be interrogated again: Delhi Police on extortion case
338.article_body: Economic Offences Wing of Delhi Police is likely to call actor Nora Fatehi once again for questioning in connection with ₹200 crore extortion case allegedly involving conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar. "She was cooperating during the investigation but there are some questions whose answers have not been found yet and there might be a need to inquire her again," said an official.

339.title: 3 labourers die after stone slabs fall at construction site in Jaipur
339.article_body: At least three labourers were killed and one got injured on Friday evening after stone slabs fell on them at a construction site in the Jagatpura area in Rajasthan's Jaipur, police said. The incident took place when the victims were shifting granite stones to a loader. Notably, the labourers were engaged in the construction of a private hospital.

340.title: 12-yr-old electrocuted in Greater Noida Ganesh Chaturthi fair, organiser held
340.article_body: A 12-year-old boy was allegedly killed by electrocution at a fair organised on the occasion of Ganesh Chaturthi in Greater Noida on Thursday. An organiser of the fair has been arrested in the case. "The post-mortem report of the deceased indicates that he died due to electric shock to his body," said Abhishek Verma, Deputy Commissioner of Police, Greater Noida.

341.title: Suspended Telangana MRO found dead at her residence in Hyderabad
341.article_body: A suspended Telangana Mandal Revenue Officer (MRO), Sujatha, who was arrested in a land scam two years ago, was allegedly found dead under suspicious circumstances at her residence in Hyderabad on Saturday. The cause of her death is yet to be ascertained. Sujatha's family member claimed that she was undergoing treatment for dengue and suffered a cardiac arrest.

342.title: 42-year-old man found hanging in police custody in J&K's Rajouri
342.article_body: A 42-year-old man, booked in two separate cases, was found hanging in a police lock-up in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district on Friday, said SSP Choudhary Mohammad Aslam. "He had made a sort of rope with the help of threads from a curtain and this morning, was found hanging from the window of the washroom," said Aslam.

343.title: Kejriwal 'biggest U-turn leader' in India: BJP leader Tejasvi Surya
343.article_body: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya on Saturday termed AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal the "biggest U-turn leader" in the country. "Arvind Kejriwal's politics is without credibility and integrity," he added. "Certainly, the youths of Gujarat will not provide even an inch of space for revdi (freebie) and bevdi (drunk) politics," Surya said while referring to the Excise Policy of the Delhi government.

344.title: 3 burglars held, valuables worth ₹33 lakh recovered in Hyderabad
344.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Saturday solved a case of burglary and arrested three persons in connection with the case. The Rachakonda Police tweeted that 36 tolas of gold ornaments, nine wrist watches, one digital camera, one two-wheeler, 405 US dollars and one mobile phone worth ₹33.02 lakh were recovered. The accused had reportedly broken into a house on August 31.

345.title: Jacqueline made conman Sukesh pay ₹15 lakh to writer for web series script: ED
345.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate, in its supplementary chargesheet filed against Jacqueline Fernandez, claimed she admitted that conman Sukesh Chandrashekar gave ₹15 lakh in cash to writer Advaita Kala for a web series script. This contradicts her earlier statement to the investigating agency that she gave only chocolates and flowers to Kala. The transaction is now part of ED investigation.

346.title: After Paras Kalnawat, co-star Alma Hussein exits 'Anupamaa'
346.article_body: Actress Alma Hussein, who played the character of Sara Kapadia in 'Anupamaa', has quit the show. Talking about her exit, she said her "track was going nowhere" and she wasn't growing as an actor.  Earlier, actor Paras Kalnawat exited the show to participate in reality show 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10'. Paras played the role of Samar Shah in 'Anupamaa'.

347.title: Punjab man opens fire after arguing with neighbour over dog's poop
347.article_body: A man, his father and other accomplices allegedly opened fire at his neighbour's house in Punjab's Ludhiana on Friday after arguing with the neighbour who objected to the man's dog defecating near his house. The accused, who are yet to be arrested, reportedly fired two shots. The police have recovered two bullet shells from the spot.

348.title: Merger of Manipur JD(U) MLAs into BJP was done using money power: Lalan Singh
348.article_body: JD(U) chief Lalan Singh accused BJP of horse trading in Manipur. "Whatever happened in Manipur (merger of JD(U) MLAs into BJP) was done by BJP using money power.
