For the PM, coming together of Opposition parties is corruption," he said. JD(U) will become a national party no matter how hard the Bharatiya Janata Party tries to stop it, Singh claimed.

349.title: 2,000 farmers died by suicide in Telangana from 2017 to 2019: FM
349.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday criticised the Telangana government saying that at least 2,000 farmers died by suicide in the state between 2017 and 2019. "There is gross injustice being done to the farmers," she said, adding that the condition of farmers wasn't as good as the TRS government claims it to be.

350.title: Day temperature in Pune city to rise over next few days: IMD
350.article_body: The day temperature in Pune city is likely to rise over the next few days, India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. "Day temperature in the city is likely to touch 34°C till September 4. Partly cloudy skies becoming generally cloudy towards the afternoon and light rainfall for the city are forecast till the end of this week," an official said.

351.title: 2-year-old girl dies after water tanker hits motorcycle in Thane
351.article_body: A two-year-old girl was killed when a water tanker hit a motorcycle in Bhiwandi, Thane. The deceased, Khatija Khan, was travelling on the motorcycle with her parents and minor sister, who also got injured in the accident, police said. The tanker owner, Pramnath Bagal, and the driver, Jairam Jaiswal, have been booked under culpable homicide charges.

352.title: Milan airport dog sniffs out 13 kg of cocaine hidden in wheelchair
352.article_body: A sniffer dog helped police at Malpensa Airport in Italy's Milan find some 13 kilograms of cocaine stuffed into the leather upholstery of a motorised wheelchair. Following the discovery, the wheelchair user, who was pretending to be a disabled person, immediately got up and walked unaided, the Financial Guard police said. The seized cocaine was worth around £1.2 million.

353.title: Actress Manju Warrier joins Ajith for a bike trip in Ladakh, shares pics
353.article_body: Actress Manju Warrier took to Instagram to share a few pictures with actor Ajith Kumar as they went on an adventurous bike tour in Ladakh. She wrote, "Huge thanks to...Super Star Rider Ajith Kumar Sir! This is the first time I'm doing a tour on a two-wheeler." The duo will be seen together in an upcoming film tentatively titled 'AK61'.

354.title: Defending champion Medvedev to face 23rd seed Kyrgios in US Open 4th round
354.article_body: Defending champion Daniil Medvedev defeated China's Wu Yibing 6-4, 6-2, 6-2 to reach the men's singles fourth round at US Open 2022. The top seed will now face 23rd seed Nick Kyrgios, who reached the fourth round at US Open for the first time in his career. The Australian beat American wildcard JJ Wolf 6-4, 6-2, 6-3 in third round.

355.title: Hybrid LeT terrorist arrested in J&K, arms & ammunition recovered
355.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir Police along with security forces arrested a hybrid terrorist of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) in the Sopore region of Kashmir, police said on Saturday. The terrorist, identified as Saqib Shakeel Dar, was planning to carry out attacks on security forces and civilians, police added. One pistol, one magazine and eight pistol rounds were recovered from him.

356.title: Pune's Chandani Chowk flyover may open by June 2023: Nitin Gadkari
356.article_body: Union Minister for Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari has directed the authorities to complete the work on Pune's Chandani Chowk flyover by June 2023. He assured if issues about land acquisition for the project are resolved and land is acquired at two places (where it's currently facing resistance), the flyover will be launched by next year.

357.title: India's forex reserves fall by $3 billion to $561.04 billion
357.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves fell by $3 billion to $561.04 billion in the week ended August 26, according to the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) data. The fall was because of a decline in the foreign currency assets (FCA) and the gold reserves. The FCA fell by $2.57 billion in the said week and gold reserves fell by $271 million.

358.title: 15 houses, 3 shops destroyed as cloudburst hits Dharamshala, rescue ops underway
358.article_body: Three shops and 15 houses were damaged after a cloudburst triggered flash floods in Himachal Pradesh's Dharamshala on Friday. Reports said that 45 sheep and goats also went missing. Senior officials directed relief workers to ramp up rehabilitation efforts. "Damage caused by rains is being reviewed and effective steps are being taken by district administration," Kangra Deputy Commissioner said.

359.title: Paytm, Razorpay's Bengaluru offices raided by ED in Chinese loan apps case
359.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) said it's conducting raids at the Bengaluru offices of Paytm, Razorpay and Cashfree Payments in connection with "illegal" instant loan apps "controlled" by Chinese persons. The culprits were generating proceeds of crime through various accounts with payment gateways. This comes after several complaints of extortion by people who took loans through such apps.

360.title: Don't quit BJP, work for AAP internally: Kejriwal tells Guj BJP workers
360.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday appealed to BJP workers in Gujarat to work for Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) while staying in BJP. "Take...payment from there (BJP) but work for us...because we don't have money," he added. Kejriwal said BJP workers will benefit from all the "guarantees" promised by him to the people when AAP comes to power in Gujarat.

361.title: Video shows BJP MLA shouting at, threatening woman activist in B'luru
361.article_body: A video has emerged showing BJP MLA Aravind Limbavali shouting at and threatening a woman activist who was protesting against the demolition of a property in Bengaluru. The woman, Ruth Sagai Mary, was heard saying, "I'm talking with respect. You're speaking to a lady." Limbavali replied, "You've encroached the land...You want respect?" He asked the police to "take her away".

362.title: SC gives Finance Ministry 30 days more to open GST common portal
362.article_body: The Supreme Court has given the Finance Ministry a 30-day extension for opening of the Goods and Services Tax (GST) common portal. It also directed the GSTN to open a common portal for all taxpayers from October 1 till December 31. This would allow taxpayers to claim pending transitional credit due at the GST launch in 2017.

363.title: Canadian TikTok star Tanya Pardazi dies aged 21 in skydiving accident
363.article_body: Canadian TikTok star Tanya Pardazi died in a skydiving accident on August 27. According to the 21-year-old former Miss Canada semi-finalist's friends, Pardazi died while performing the activity in Ontario, Canada. Pardazi opened her parachute too late while in the air during her first solo course, according to a statement by the skydiving company.

364.title: Will Smith showed he's as ugly as rest of us: Dave Chappelle on Oscars slap
364.article_body: Comedian Dave Chappelle on his England tour with Chris Rock spoke about the latter being slapped by Will Smith at the 2022 Oscars. Dave said onstage, "A lot of people forget who Will Smith is...Will did the impression of a perfect person for 30 years and he...showed us he was as ugly as the rest of us."

365.title: People who abuse PM are crying about freedom of expression: Kiren Rijiju
365.article_body: Reacting to retired SC judge Justice BN Srikrishna's "freedom of expression" remark, Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said that people who abuse the popularly elected PM are crying about freedom of expression. In an interview, Srikrishna had said, "If I say that I don't like the face of PM, somebody might raid me, arrest me, throw me in the jail."

366.title: Youth hacks leopard to death after it pounces on him in Kerala
366.article_body: A tribal youth hacked a leopard to death in Kerala's Idukki on Saturday in alleged self-defence, forest officials said. The youth, who suffered injuries and was admitted to a hospital, used a machete-like weapon to attack the leopard after it pounced on him and mauled him. "A detailed probe would be held," Mankulam Divisional Forest Officer G Jayachandran said.

367.title: Pic made using AI wins art prize in US; criticised by artists
367.article_body: Several artists are criticising the decision to award the first prize to an AI-generated artwork in the digital art category in the Colorado State Fair's annual art competition. Jason Allen used an AI program called Midjourney to create the art and touched it up a bit. "I'm not going to apologise...I won, and I didn't break any rules," said Allen.

368.title: FBI found over 11,000 govt records at Trump's home, unsealed records show
368.article_body: The FBI recovered more than 11,000 government documents and photographs, including 18 labelled as 'top secret', during its August 8 search at ex-US President Donald Trump's Florida home, according to court records that were unsealed on Friday. The FBI also seized 90 empty folders, 48 of which were marked 'classified' and 42 were labelled 'Return to Staff Secretary/Military Aide'.

369.title: Man arrested for raping 15-yr-old girl in Thane
369.article_body: A 19-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping and threatening a 15-year-old girl in Thane. The accused, Sameer Khan, used to stalk the girl, who was also his neighbour, and tried to speak to her multiple times, police said. The accused forcefully entered the victim's house last week when the latter's parents were away and allegedly committed the crime.

370.title: Motorcyclist killed after drunk woman mows him down in Delhi; arrested
370.article_body: A 35-year-old woman was arrested on Friday in East Delhi for allegedly mowing down a motorcyclist under the influence of alcohol, police said. The accident took place on NH-9 in East Vinod Nagar. The man, identified as 28-year-old Shakarpur resident Abhishek Kapoor, was rushed to MAX Hospital in Patparganj but was declared brought dead. A case has been registered.

371.title: Delhi Police arrests 2 men with 1.3 kg heroin worth ₹2 crore
371.article_body: Delhi Police arrested two men in Rohini with 1.3 kilograms of heroin worth ₹2 crore. One of the accused earlier spent five years in jail in connection with a robbery at Lahori Gate in 2014, police said. The second accused is a childhood friend of the first and was earlier arrested in a case under the Excise Act, police added.

372.title: Hrithik Roshan to sport 3 different looks for 'Vikram Vedha', pics surface
372.article_body: Pictures have surfaced on social media which show actor Hrithik Roshan in his upcoming film 'Vikram Vedha'. As per reports, the actor will be seen sporting three different looks for the film to show the backstory of his character Vedha. The film is touted to be an action-thriller directed by filmmaking duo Pushkar-Gayatri and also features Saif Ali Khan.

373.title: Massive eviction drive to clear 330 acres of land underway in Assam
373.article_body: A massive eviction and anti-encroachment drive began in Assam's Sonitpur on Saturday morning to clear 330 acres of land. Over 1,000 security personnel have been deployed, state IGP (L&O) PK Bhuyan said. As most residents have vacated their houses, heavy machinery is being used to demolish the structures. According to government records, 299 families were living there, reported PTI.

374.title: Gujarat AAP chief Gopal Italia booked for defaming BJP leaders
374.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party's Gujarat President Gopal Italia has been booked for allegedly defaming BJP leaders, including the state's MoS Home Harsh Sanghavi and party's state chief CR Paatil. The complainant alleged that Italia called Sanghavi "Drugs Sanghavi" and Paatil a "former bootlegger". He further claimed that the AAP leader incited the public against the state.

375.title: I have shut it out of life: Karan Johar on boycott Bollywood trend
375.article_body: Speaking about the boycott Bollywood trend on social media, filmmaker Karan Johar said that he has shut it out of life and chooses to focus only on positivity. He added that by listening and reacting to negative things, you attract the same energy. "I think that you have to turn a blind eye towards negativity in general," the filmmaker said.

376.title: When I look at Rahul's body language, I feel he can't do anything: RP Singh
376.article_body: Ex-India pacer RP Singh said Rishabh Pant should be picked in the lineup for Team India's upcoming match against Pakistan, going on to name KL Rahul as the player who should be rested. "Rahul isn't showing much promise. When I look at his body language, it feels he can't do anything," added Singh. "His...reading of match situations [is]...concerning," he stated.

377.title: 3 auto drivers rob man of phone, cash in Pimpri-Chinchwad; arrested
377.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Police on Friday arrested three autorickshaw drivers who allegedly robbed a man of his phone and cash worth a total of ₹16,000. The incident took place on Tuesday when the man, who is a construction worker, hired an autorickshaw to travel from Alandi to Dudulgaon. A police sub-inspector said that the trio had threatened the man.

378.title: 'Danielle' becomes first Atlantic hurricane this year, moving at 120 km/hr
378.article_body: Tropical storm 'Danielle' has strengthened into the first hurricane of 2022 Atlantic Ocean season, the US National Hurricane Center said. The storm, which became a hurricane just before 10:50 am Eastern time on Friday, doesn't present immediate threat to land. It was about 1,440 km west of the Azores in the North Atlantic with maximum sustained winds of 120 km/hr.

379.title: We are mulling India listing: Nasdaq-listed MakeMyTrip’s Founder
379.article_body: MakeMyTrip Founder and Chairman Deep Kalra said the travel aggregator is thinking of getting listed in India. "When we listed in 2010, India was not ready for internet stocks," he said. Kalra also said that some of the internet companies which went public last year in India may have been misguided. The Nasdaq-listed MakeMyTrip settled at $33 apiece on Thursday.

380.title: Citi cuts mortgage team's size amid housing market slowdown in US
380.article_body: Citigroup on Friday said it has fired some workers of its mortgage team "due to internal streamlining of functions" and is helping affected workers find new roles "within Citi or outside the firm". Reportedly, less than 100 positions were affected by the job cuts. This comes as increasing prices and mortgage rates have slowed down the housing market in US.

381.title: Thanks Serena Williams for everything you've done for our sport: Nadal
381.article_body: After 23-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams played the last match of her career at US Open 2022, Rafael Nadal took to Instagram Stories and wrote, "Thanks Serena Williams for everything you've done for our sport!!! Amazing champion." Unseeded Australian Ajla Tomljanovic beat Serena 7-5, 6-7(4-7), 6-1 in the third round in New York today.

382.title: Skyroot Aerospace raises $51 million in funding round led by GIC
382.article_body: Hyderabad-based space-tech startup Skyroot Aerospace has raised around $51 million in a Series B financing round led by GIC. GIC's India Managing Director Mayank Rawat will now join Skyroot's board. This is the largest funding round ever in the Indian space-tech sector, the company said. Skyroot Aerospace was founded by Pawan Kumar Chandana and Naga Bharath Daka in 2018.

383.title: Crypto firm's CEO, who faces 40,000-yr jail for stealing $2 bn, arrested in Albania
383.article_body: Turkish cryptocurrency exchange platform Thodex's CEO Faruk Fatih Özer, accused of stealing $2 billion from thousands of clients, has been arrested in Albania, said Turkey. Further, the process to extradite Özer, who fled Turkey after Thodex was shut down last year, has started. He, along with other executives of Thodex, faces over 40,000 years in prison for alleged fraud.

384.title: Age is not what body tells you, but what your mind tells body: Sachin as Serena retires
384.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar took to Twitter to congratulate Serena Williams following her retirement aged 40. He wrote, "Age is not what the body tells you...but what your mind tells the body. Teenagers can solve world's biggest problems, adults can pick up something new & excel." He added, "Sport inspires society to push limits & achieve the impossible....Congratulations on an inspiring career."

385.title: I love being objectified, I'm just a piece of meat: Ranveer Singh
385.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh made an appearance on reality show 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' in which he said, "I love being objectified. I am just a piece of meat. Just a battery-operated device." He also complimented Sanjay Kapoor's wife Maheep Kapoor over her appearance in 1994 music video 'Nigori Kaisi Jawani Hai', saying she looked like a malai kofta.

386.title: Security beefed up in Goshamahal in view of bandh over Raja Singh's arrest
386.article_body: In view of the shutdown called by supporters of suspended BJP MLA Raja Singh, Hyderabad Police has beefed up security in parts of Goshamahal constituency. "Why a hate speaker like Owaisi was not held under the Preventive Detentions (PD) Act and why only Raja Singh has been held under it? Government [is working] with AIMIM," said Sri Ram Yuva Sena.

387.title: Goa Police recovers 3 diaries from Sonali Phogat’s Haryana residence
387.article_body: Goa Police have recovered three diaries from the Haryana residence of late TikTok star and BJP leader Sonali Phogat. Police also inspected Sonali's bedroom, wardrobe, and password-protected locker. The locker has been sealed by the police, reports said. "We are still investigating and scrutinizing the case...a conclusion can only be drawn once we are through with investigation," police said.

388.title: Revoke or face 'counter-measures': China to US on $1.1 bn arms package to Taiwan
388.article_body: China on Friday warned the US to revoke the $1.1 billion arms package to Taiwan and warned the country of "counter-measures" on failing to do so. It added that the aid to Taiwan "severely jeopardises" the relations between the US and China. "China will resolutely take legitimate and necessary counter-measures," Chinese embassy spokesman Liu Pengyu said.

389.title: Ranveer Singh makes his first startup investment, invests in SUGAR Cosmetics
389.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has made his first startup investment by investing in beauty products startup SUGAR Cosmetics. The startup announced the actor's investment on Saturday, however, it didn't disclose the amount of investment. Founded by IIM Ahmedabad alumni Vineeta Singh and Kaushik Mukherjee, the startup sells cosmetics through both online and offline routes. In May, it raised $50 million.

390.title: Motherf*cker hit me over nicest joke I ever told: Chris Rock on Oscars slap
390.article_body: Comedian Chris Rock during his comedy show with Dave Chappelle in England joked with the audience about the 2022 Oscars slap incident. He said, "Did that sh*t hurt? Goddamn right. The motherf*cker hit me over a bullsh*t joke, the nicest joke I ever told." Chris had joked about Will Smith's wife Jada Pinkett Smith's lack of hair due to alopecia.

391.title: Develop State Capital Region on lines of Delhi-NCR: UP CM to officials
391.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath has directed officials to form 'Uttar Pradesh State Capital Region (SCR)' along the lines of the Delhi-National Capital Region (NCR). During a review meeting, Yogi said the population pressure is increasing in the neighbouring districts of Lucknow. Therefore, keeping future requirements in mind, Lucknow and its surrounding districts can be developed into an SCR, Yogi added.

392.title: Expanding anus by hands & pouring substance in it, prima facie not carnal intercourse: HC
392.article_body: Bombay High Court observed that act of "expanding the anus by hands and pouring some substance into it, prima facie cannot be said to be...carnal intercourse". The court said this while granting bail to a man accused of unnatural offences against a seven-year-old girl. The court noted that no injuries to the anus were recorded in her medical report.

393.title: Amazon's $1.7 billion takeover of iRobot under review in US: Report
393.article_body: US' Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has reportedly started reviewing Amazon's $1.7 billion deal to acquire Roomba vacuum maker iRobot. The wide-ranging review will analyse whether the deal will illegally boost Amazon's market share in both the connected device market and the retail market in general, Politico reported citing sources. The all-cash deal was announced last month.

394.title: Man dies as 25 gunny bags full of rice fall on him in godown in Tamil Nadu
394.article_body: A 35-year-old man died after 25 gunny bags full of rice fell on him in a godown in Tamil Nadu's Periyapalayam. Reports said he had been asked to stack the bags on the shelves. He reportedly sat down to rest when the bags came falling down on him. A few employees rushed to incident site after they heard his voice.

395.title: Big B shares poster, release date of 'Goodbye' with Rashmika
395.article_body: Veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan on Saturday took to social media to share the poster of his upcoming film 'Goodbye' which also features Rashmika Mandanna and Neena Gupta. He wrote alongside the poster that the film will release in theatres on October 7. He can be seen flying a kite in the poster as Rashmika holds the kite spool.

396.title: Audience wants more than what we're delivering: Jr NTR on film industry
396.article_body: Speaking about the failures faced by the Indian film industry, actor Jr NTR said that the audience wants more than what they are delivering. He further said that the film industry is under pressure and needs to accept this challenge to make better films for the audience. "Not putting anybody down here. Let's accept the challenge," the actor added.

397.title: Gunmen kidnap worshippers attending prayers at mosque in Nigeria
397.article_body: Gunmen have kidnapped dozens of worshippers attending Friday afternoon prayers at a mosque in Zamfara state in Nigeria, police said. "The Zamfara state police command in collaboration with military and vigilantes have dispatched personnel for the search and rescue operation," a police spokesman said. The men were reportedly disguised as worshippers and hid the guns under their garments.

398.title: MP govt exempts students of 1.30 lakh schools from carrying bags once a week
398.article_body: Madhya Pradesh government has decided to exempt students of 1.30 lakh schools from carrying bags once a week. MP has 1.30 lakh schools with a collective strength of 1.54 crore students, an official said. The students of Classes 1-2 will have to carry school bags weighing 1.6 to 2.2 kg while students of Classes 3-5, weighing 1.7 to 2.5 kg.

399.title: Venus Williams is the only reason I ever existed: Serena Williams
399.article_body: Following her 5-7, 7-6(7-4), 1-6 defeat against Australia's Ajla Tomljanović in the US Open's third round, marking her career's last match, Serena Williams said her sister Venus Williams is the "only reason" she ever existed. "It's been the most incredible...journey I've ever been on...in my life," added Serena. "It all started with my parents and they deserved everything," she stated.

400.title: Madrassa caretaker in Hyd arrested for sexually assaulting student
400.article_body: A madrassa caretaker has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a 14-year-old student in Hyderabad. The accused, identified as Qasim, was booked under POCSO Act after the victim's mother filed a complaint with the police. The minor boy was reportedly assaulted several times and was threatened with dire consequences if he revealed the ordeal to anyone.

401.title: India pips UK, our colonial ruler: Kotak on India becoming 5th largest economy
401.article_body: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak said it is a "proud moment for India to pip UK, our colonial ruler" to become the world's fifth largest economy. "But a reality check of population denominator: India: 1.4 bn vs UK: 0.068 bn. Hence, per capita GDP we [are] at $2,500 vs $47,000. We've miles to go," Kotak wrote in a tweet.
